content:
As an AI language model, I don't have personal preferences. I can mention some calendar tools that are popular and may be suitable for your needs:

1. Google Calendar: It is free, easy to use, and syncs across all your devices. You can also share it with coworkers, set reminders, and create events with multiple attendees.

2. Outlook Calendar: It is a productivity tool that is widely used in corporate settings. It offers many features, including scheduling meetings, group calendars, and email integration.

3. Apple Calendar: An inbuilt calendar tool in Apple devices that syncs with all devices using the iCloud. It is a user-friendly tool that offers handy features like color coding, drag-and-drop events, and sending invitations.

4. Any.do: It is a popular to-do list and task manager app that offers a built-in calendar. You can create to-do lists or reminders and link them to your calendar events.

5. Trello: A visual collaboration tool that allows you to create boards, add cards, and set deadlines. You can also link your Trello board with your calendar to get updates on upcoming events.

Remember, there are many calendar tools available, and the right one for you depends on your personal needs and preferences. Don't be afraid to try out a few different options before settling on one.
